str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To know, know of, understand. Apparently a middle voice of ephistemi; to put the mind upon, i.e. Comprehend, or be acquainted with.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
This; he, she, it.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To speak freely, boldly; To be confident.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
No one, none, nothing.
This; he, she, it.
A prolonged form of a primary verb, which is used only as an alternate in certain tenses; to lie hid; often used adverbially, unwittingly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact, require.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A corner; met: a secret place. Probably akin to gonu; an angle.
